  "Broker Comment" : "APPLICANT WAS ORDERED TO PAY CUSTOMER $5,968.75 PLUS INTEREST. ADAMS SUED CHARTERED SYSTEMS LTD. NAMING ME AS BROKER, CHARTERED SYSTEMS LATER BECAME UNDER CAPITALIZED AND SAID \"NO CONTEST\". JUDGE SHIPE ORDERED ME TO PAY AS CHARTERED SYSTEMS WAS NOW OUT OF BUSINESS. THE JUDGE SAID \"EVEN THOUGH IT'S UNFAIR TO MCKEE SHE HAS TO PAY.\" ADAMS INITIATED THE BUSINESS CONTACT BY CALLING ME TO INQUIRE ABOUT COMMODITY INVESTING. I EXPLAINED THE CONCEPTS AND PROCEDURES THE RISKS AND THE CONTRACTS OF CHARTERED SYSTEMS. SHE CALLED MANY TIMES AND EVENTUALLY DECIDED TO ENTER A LONG TERM LIFETIME FUTURES CONTRACT FOR $8000. IT HAD A LIFETIME FREE ENTRY FEE OF $3000, $3000 WAS PUT INTO THE MARKET. $2000 WAS MARGIN. A STOP LOSS WAS ENTERED. SHE SIGNED ALL THE RISK DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS. SHE DID NOT DISCLOSE SALARY. THE PAPERS WERE RETURNED TO THE BACK OFFICE & I DID NOT SEE THEM. SHE WORKED AS A COUNSELOR OF C.U.N.Y. AND OWNED RENTAL PROPERTY."
